text:
Vin Diesel is trying to make things work between cast members of the Fast & Furious franchise. This week, Universal Pictures announced they are releasing the next installment of the franchise in 2020, one year later than initially planned.

One day later, the studio again revealed a new spin-off movie would hit theaters starring Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson and Jason Statham. The film hits theaters in two years, 2019.

As you may already know, this angered Tyrese Gibson, who took to Instagram several times to blame Dwayne for the delay of the movie.

Just a few days before Tyrese’s ex-wife accused him of child abuse, the actor used his social media account to insult Dwayne’s role in Baywatch while simultaneously stating the actor made the franchise “all about him.”

However, Vin appears to be unfazed by all of the drama; he wrote on his Instagram page, “Brotherhood…and all its complexities.”He added, “this scene was filmed in Puerto Rico. I can remember it like it was yesterday. Such a beautiful island.”

According to the leading star of the series, a woman on Facebook requested that he work with “The Rock,” and Vin “listened to her request and he became Hobbs.”

Additionally, Vin said it’s not “anyone’s fault,” when referring to the rescheduling of the ninth movie of the series. Diesel added that like any well-used vehicle, the franchise requires maintenance.

Advertisement

“My good friend and the godfather of Universal, Ron Meyer, has granted me the time to do just that.” As for the former-wrestler-turned-actor, Dwayne Johnson, in recent years, has worked hard to make himself one of the highest paid actors in the world. In fact, he comes in at number 2 on Forbes 2017 list just after Mark Wahlberg. Fans of “The Rock” will remember his rise to fame as a professional wrestler where his famous saying was, “Can you smell what “The Rock” is cooking?”
title: Vin Diesel Talks Fast And Furious 9 Drama
